meanings.definition: To disconnect or separate from something
meanings.sent1: She disassociated herself from the toxic relationship.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut disassociated from the spacecraft before reentry.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces seemed to disassociate themselves when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His mind disassociated from reality as he delved into the book.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick made it appear as if the card disassociated from the deck.

meanings.definition: To dissociate oneself from a group or organization
meanings.sent1: He disassociated from the club due to conflicting beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She disassociated herself from the political party after the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to disassociate from the other pets and explore the garden alone.
meanings.sent4: The employee disassociated from the company to pursue a new career path.
meanings.sent5: The student disassociated from the study group to focus on individual learning.

meanings.definition: Not connected or related to something
meanings.sent1: The disassociated ideas in his essay made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her disassociated comments seemed out of place in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The disassociated colors clashed in the painting, creating a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: The disassociated events of the day left him feeling confused.
meanings.sent5: The disassociated memories resurfaced unexpectedly during the therapy session.
